text:
Multivariable Calculus | Some properties of derivatives of vector valued functions.

\begin{array}{l}\n\frac{\mathbf{d}}{\mathbf{d t}}(\mathbf{u} \cdot \mathbf{v})=\mathbf{u}^{\prime} \cdot \mathbf{v}+\mathbf{u} \cdot \mathbf{v}^{\prime} \\\n\frac{\mathbf{d}}{\mathrm{d} \mathbf{t}}(\mathbf{u} \times \mathbf{v})=\mathbf{u}^{\prime} \times \mathbf{v}+\mathbf{u} \times \mathbf{v}^{\prime}\n\end{array}[imath]\frac{\mathbf{d}}{\mathbf{d t}}(\mathbf{u} \cdot \mathbf{v})=\mathbf{u}^{\prime} \cdot \mathbf{v}+\mathbf{u} \cdot \mathbf{v}^{\prime} [/imath] [imath]\frac{\mathbf{d}}{\mathrm{d} \mathbf{t}}(\mathbf{u} \times \mathbf{v})=\mathbf{u}^{\prime} \times \mathbf{v}+\mathbf{u} \times \mathbf{v}^{\prime}[/imath]
